dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANITA "NEEDY" LESNICKI, 17, sits on her hospital bed in pajamas. She's a plain-faced girl with a haunted expression. As she stares out the window, she winds colored yarn around a pair of Popsicle sticks to create a "god's eye."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out a single window, we see an imposing nine-foot SECURITY FENCE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next to Needy, we see a pile of unopened mail scattered casually on the floor. There are letters, packages, even creepy little gifts and totems sent by admiring "fans."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every day, I get letters. I think I get more letters than Santa Claus, Zac Efron and Dr. Phil combined. I'm kind of the shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAYMUNDO, a counselor raps on the door and sticks his head in cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rec time in five minutes, Needy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grassy-ass, Raymundo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy stands up and begins changing into an institutional gym uniform. As she slips off her pajamas, we can see a series of puffy, slash-like SCARS on her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes the letters are from people who say they're praying for me. They tell me everything will be okay if I just accept Jesus Christ into my heart. I say the words, but nothing ever happens. Nobody comes back. Nobody gets off the cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances sadly at a PHOTO OF A BOY on her dresser. She touches the frame wistfully, her eyes full of remorse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Occasionally I get presents from starfuckers who saw my picture in the paper and want to marry me or something. They think they can take me away from all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I'd really date some perverted Chester with a hard-on for jailbait. I might be insane, but I'm not desperate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a morbid "hall of fame" of creepy photos sent in from guys. They line the mirror, grinning at us. There's even a DICK SHOT tucked in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy pulls on her threadbare uniform T-shirt. It hangs down to her knees, covering her shorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of people ask me if I'm sorry I did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy picks up a paper cup of COLORFUL PILLS on her dresser, dumps the meds into her mouth, and dry-swallows them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I didn't do it sooner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She saunters out of the room in her GYM UNIFORM and BUNNY SLIPPERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several badminton courts are set up in the gym. As an intense OPERATIC ARIA plays over the public address system, the FEMALE PATIENTS enthusiastically--almost violently--whack at the flying shuttlecocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The patients appear to be varying levels of crazy. A TOOTHLESS WOMAN grins as she dives with her racket, clipping her partner in the leg. In the corner, one forlorn patient nurses her injured arm while another hurls her racket against the wall again and again. Counselors look on approvingly, despite how miserable their charges appear. In the background, a few sulking patients jump rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy enters the gym unnoticed, padding along in her bunny slippers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Mental Olympics. They're big on recreation here. Supposedly it helps us vent our aggressions. We've traded in our hatchets for rackets, our Drain-O bombs for double dutch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even the cutters get in on the action when they're fully conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a GIRL swinging a jump rope who has a ladder of fresh bandages on her arms and legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I'm just trying to stay invisible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nelly shuffles over to a tetherball and takes a furious WHACK at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freshly showered PATIENTS assemble for breakfast. They grab trays and settle into noisy cliques. Needy selects a single toaster pastry from the breakfast line and sits down, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Personally, I think they're trying to wear us out. Keep us sluggish so there won't be an uprising. Well, those J.V. tactics won't work against me. I'm a kicker. K-I- C-K-E-R. It even says so on my chart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We briefly cut to Needy's chart, on some doctor's clipboard. We see her name: ANITA "NEEDY" LESNICKI and a few brief details about FIRST DEGREE MURDER and GRANDIOSE NOTIONS. Beneath that, we see a triple-highlighted warning in bright ink: KICKER. A NUTRITIONIST with a clipboard approaches Needy casually and eyes her breakfast plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one Toastem, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like Toastems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. But I'm not sure a Toastem can provide you with sufficient energy for your day. I'd recommend more complex carbohydrates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy scrambles to her feet and delivers a sudden, powerful ROUNDHOUSE KICK to the nutritionist's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'D RECOMMEND THAT YOU SHUT THE FUCK UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nutritionist is KNOCKED OFF HER FEET-- as if she's been kicked by a far mightier creature than Needy-- and collapses, clutching her bleeding nose. We see that the bone has SNAPPED. The patients shriek. Chaos. As Needy is restrained by staff members, she thrashes like a trapped fish. Needy snorts up a killer LOOGIE and hocks it at the prone nutritionist. The glob nails her in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes four STAFF MEMBERS to haul Needy away as she hollers in protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nutritionist curls up on the floor, cupping her bleeding nose as a ring of curious patients surrounds her. She spits out a TOOTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy is tossed into seclusion. Her hair is wild and her face is wet with tears. The heavy door slams behind her, leaving only a shaft of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't always this cracked. I used to be normal-- well, as normal as any girl under the influence of teenage hormones. But after the killings began, I started to feel, I don't know... loose around the edges or something. I was coming undone like those jeans I made in Home Ec. Falling to pieces like Patsy Cline. Shredded like moo-shu pork. Dead inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy cringes as she briefly hallucinates abstract SHAPES in the darkness. Grinning skulls. Faces drained of life, half eaten. Grimaces of terror. Suddenly, soft music   is piped into "the hole," ostensib to calm the patients   in solitary. Needy shudders and recoils at the sound   of it. It's a CHEESY ROCK BALLAD that we'll soon hear   again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Through the trees, I will find you. Heal the ruins left inside you. And the stars will remind you, we'll meet again..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I hate this fucking song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy plugs her ears as if it physically hurts her to listen to the song. She curls up in the corner and steels herself for solitary confinement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devil's Kettle is a quiet farming community, surrounded by dense woods and mirrored lakes. It's the kind of town that has one high school, one pizza joint, and one stoplight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On an overgrown rural route we see a rustic sign that reads "WELCOME TO DEVIL'S KETTLE- Pop. 7,036. Come See What's Cookin'!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where it all went down. "Devil's Kettle" sounds twisted, I know, but the place just is named after a dumb waterfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the titular falls, surprisingly powerful, gushing over a rock face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well technically, it's two waterfalls. One of them is normal-- it empties into a river basin. But the other one goes into a hole. And it doesn't come out. The scientist guys can't explain it. They've dropped all kinds of things down there--bouncy balls, red dye, radioactive slime-- but nothing ever surfaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's another dimension. Or, you know, just really deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sprawling ranch house is dark from the outside except for a single FIRST FLOOR WINDOW-- Jennifer's-- still illuminated. There's a chicken coop and a wire livestock pen in the backyard. We're definitely in deep north country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've probably spent years of my life in this house. Hundreds of sleepovers, thousands of aimless homework sessions, a million phone calls. I've climbed through Jennifer's window so many times. But tonight, only one of us is going to come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JENNIFER CHECK lies on her bed, fidgeting as she watches TV. She's a girl of 16 with LONG, MATTED HAIR and a thin, frail body. Her features are gorgeous, but she looks sick and haggard. She picks at her skin with yellowed, Nosferatu-like fingernails and chews idly on a limp lock of hair. Jennifer wears a tight T-shirt that says KETTLE HIGH FLAGS and underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An `80s HORROR MOVIE flickers on the TV. Jennifer half- watches, distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer didn't always look this rough. Actually, she was the prettiest girl in Devil's Kettle when she wasn't so...hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some recent photos on a corkboard reveal that Jennifer was indeed BEAUTIFUL AND CURVY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hadn't fed in weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer rolls over and glances at the window briefly. We see the OUTSIDE of the house again. It's dark and silent, but for the nearly inaudible snapping of twigs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer turns her attention back to the TV. Suddenly, we see NEEDY'S FACE pop up against the window, white and startling. Before Jennifer notices, the face disappears. Outside the house, the bushes rustle. Needy is crouched below the window. We hear the pulsing of her HEART as if via ultrasound. It's a wet, rhythmic sound: Sploish, sploish, sploish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, Jennifer stretches and shuts off the TV. She turns out the light. A beat of silence. Then, the sound of cracking near the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy PLUNGES through the window, screaming and brandishing a HAMMER. She takes a SWING at Jennifer's head, but misses and BURIES IT IN THE WALL, specifically in Jennifer's Fall Out Boy poster. Needy throws herself on top of Jennifer. She STRADDLES Jennifer and grips her throat, throttling her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll throw me a bone, huh? Huh? You killed Chip! You goddamned monster! You...ZOMBITCH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer struggles to fight off Needy in the darkness. Her clawlike fingernails rake Needy's back and arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy pulls a BOX CUTTER out of her waistband and flicks it open like a switchblade. Kshink!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you buy all your murder weapons at Home Depot? God, you're butch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what this is for? Cutting boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a swipe at Jennifer's CROTCH. Jennifer instinctively CLUTCHES herself and rears up in defense. We see Jennifer's mouth come down on Needy's neck. Needy shrieks as if BITTEN, but continues to strangle Jennifer, straddling her and bearing down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer's T-shirt slides up to her armpits, exposing her breasts. For a moment, her eyes meet Needy's and she grins. It's as if she has control over Needy for a split second, sexual control... Needy recoils and SLASHES Jennifer's body left and right with the box-cutter, marking a gory, oozing "X" on her torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROSS OUT JENNIFER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer gasps, staring at her wounds in shock and disbelief. She looks back up at Needy. A beat of silence. Suddenly, THE GIRLS' BODIES LEVITATE RAPIDLY TOWARD THE CEILING. They wrestle in a bloody, screaming airborne heap, their figures entwined. Their bodies FALL, collapsing back onto the bed with a thud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy raises the box-cutter and plunges it into Jennifer's HEART. Blood GEYSERS from the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My tit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the room is flooded with BRIGHT LIGHT, revealing a Needy straddling Jennifer's MUTLIATED BODY. Jennifer's breathing is a raspy death rattle. MRS. CHECK, a middle-aged woman in bad sleepwear and a worse perm rushes into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer! What is it, baby? Oh my God! Oh my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls Needy off her daughter. Jennifer rolls over, gasping and bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy drops the boxcutter. It lands on Jennifer's copy of Flag Team Quarterly, splashing the model with fresh gore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she dead, Mrs. Check? Did I get her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Check cradles her maimed daughter on the floor like a white-trash Pieta. Jennifer takes one last breath, vomits blood, and DIES. Mrs. Check SCREAMS. Needy SMILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three police cars squeal up to the curb with sirens and lights engaged. OFFICER ROMAN DUDA, 22, a muscular young COP, jogs authoritatively toward the house. He shakes his head, dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, Needy, what have you done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy, innocent-looking in PIGTAILS, is hustled into the back of the squad car. Her clothes and face are smeared with blood. Officer Duda starts the ignition. His partner, a hard- faced FEMALE COP, slides into the front seat. Her cap is pushed back to accommodate a huge round pouf of shellacked MALL BANGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Roman! How's the Force treating you? I like that jaunty cap. Blue like your balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you do this, Needy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed Jen-- Jennifer-- I mean, the victim. Are you on something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's going to be okay now. I rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth back there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Didn't you used to baby-sit me in like 1998? When my mom worked the overnight at Hormel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The female cop fidgets uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Gracie, right? Gracie. I really like your hair, Gracie. How many cans of Salon Selectives did it take to erect that monument?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop reaches into the backseat and SLAPS Needy, who hiccups with laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch it, Puffy Combs. That's police brutality!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're one to talk about brutality, Ms. Lesnicki. You're looking at attempted murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh, don't say attempted. That sounds so JV. Small time. Teeny- weeny, just like Officer Duda up there. And trust me-- I'd know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roman swallows nervously, eyes on the road. Officer Warzak glances at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get our facts straight: I successfully committed a hard core, fully premeditated murder back there. I fucking destroyed that brat, OK? I, Needy Lesnicki, put a stop-payment on Jennifer Check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slumps down in the backseat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I even in these cuffs? I just saved every guy in this town from becoming Satan Chow. I'm a hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's delirious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is going to be a circus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least we've already got a confession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confessions are for pussies. You've got a declaration, Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She giggles maniacally. Roman turns on the radio, violating protocol. It's a soaring rock anthem-- the SAME SONG we heard being piped into solitary confinement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both cops BRIGHTEN when they hear the song. Roman cranks the volume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I love this song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. And they've done so much for this town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're way more than a band, really. They're heroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, this is my favorite part...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roman and the female cop begin to sing along with the uplifting, corny song:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in unison) "Through the trees, I will find you. Heal the ruins left inside you. And the stars will remind you, that you are home..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy stares out the window at the sun creeping up over the forest on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I killed her. Whatever. It won't undo anything. Three pulses-- three lives-- all stopped cold by adolescent bloodlust. It's hard to believe that just two months ago, me, Jennifer and my boyfriend Chip were completely normal people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were our yearbook pictures. Nothing more, nothing less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a brief montage of black-and-white yearbook stills: JENNIFER executing the splits on a football field, her smile bright. NEEDY inspecting a school newspaper layout, pen in hand, glasses on her nose. And finally, CHIP DOVE, playing a strap-on snare drum at a school pep rally, his head bent in concentration....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Chip..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photo fades into the pep rally itself. CHIP is animated, drumming in full color...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP drums on the sidelines of the Devil's Kettle High basketball court. The stands are packed with BORED STUDENTS for a pep rally. Chip is 16, clean cut, and an awful drummer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip couldn't drum for shit. He only knew "Land of a Thousand Dances" and the solo from "Wipeout." Lucky for him, the pep band gig wasn't too demanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure enough, the band is playing "Land of a Thousand Dances." Nearby, the FLAG TEAM claps with gloved hands, picking up their flags for a choreographed stunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer steps forward in her flag team uniform, breathtakingly beautiful. She hoists her flag aloft, twirling it. Time FREEZES as the flag unfurls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can believe it, that's Jennifer. Yeah, the same girl I iced with the box-cutter. Only back then, we were tight. Sisters, practically. People found it hard to believe that a babe like Jennifer would associate with a dork like me. But we'd been the Wonder Twins since we were practically preverbal. Sandbox love never dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer finishes her maneuver and WAVES to the stands. Needy waves back at her excitedly from the bleachers, small and owlish with glasses and lank hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHASTITY, a similarly geeky-looking girl standing next to Needy, rolls her eyes at this display of affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're totally lesbigay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? She's my best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The geeky girl mockingly imitates Needy's excited wave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stare at her like you want to dry hump her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, hump her through pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you jealous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what? That rich bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy digs through her locker, carefully selecting textbooks to take home. Jennifer skips up to her, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Monistat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Vagisil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and me are going out tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She checks herself out in Needy's locker mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soft Shoulder are playing at the Carousel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's all-ages, for once, which means I won't have to play Hello Titty with the door guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Soft Shoulder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're this indie band from the city. I saw their MySpace and the singer is extra salty. And there will be lots of other salty morsels there for you. Come on Needy, it's the weekend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thursday counts as the weekend in college. And we're going to be in college twenty-three months from now. University of Northern Minnesota Duluth- woo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy continues loading her backpack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, please you're a social disease?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer pouts. With an outstretched finger, she draws a dramatic X in the air over Needy and boos loudly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boo! Cross out Needy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy blushes, shrinking self-consciously. She obviously hates to displease Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. What time is the show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll pick you up at 8:30. My mom has a date with that guy who owns the ham store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Mom says he's got a huge... heart. So huge he gave her a recurring bladder infection. Wear something cool, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy is standing in a small, dingy bathroom, trying on different configurations of clothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Wear something cool" meant something very specific in Jennifer-speak. It meant I couldn't look like a nerd, but I couldn't upstage her either. I could expose my stomach, but never cleavage. Tits were her trademark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy wiggles her jeans a bit lower, exposing her childishly round tummy. She walks out of the bathroom into her bedroom, a frilly pink hell complete with canopy bed. CHIP DOVE is sitting on the bed, looking lost in all that pink. He raises an eyebrow at Needy's abdomen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those jeans are hella low. I can almost see your front butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip, it's a rock show. This is my rock look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see, like, your womb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy sighs and hoists up her pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you blowing me off for some dumb concert, anyway? We were supposed to have Movie Night. I even rented Orca. It's like Jaws, except with a harmless whale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer needs me. She really wants to go see this band. It's extremely important to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never even heard of Soft Shoulder. Which one is Jennifer stalking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lead singer, of course. Girls like her don't go out with drummers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offense. I mean, she'd probably make an exception for a drummer who was also the lead singer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Phil Collins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Phil Collins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. He's seminal, but whatever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, this singer guy is like 22, so he could get locked up in the state pen if he actually dated her. But Jennifer says he's extra salty, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salty. You guys ever going to stop using that secret language?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Salty" means beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you must be soy sauce, babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy and CHIP start MAKING OUT. CHIP unbuckles his belt eagerly even though they've barely begun. Needy stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy shrugs. A beat of silence. Then we hear the door swing open. JENNIFER'S VOICE floats up from downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy, quit tampooning yourself and get down here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fucking weird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straightening her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always do what Jennifer tells you to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy pulls her NECKLACE out from beneath her shirt and flashes a heart-shaped "B.F.F." charm at Chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my best friend, Chip. Remember? This necklace is no joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP sighs, resigned. They head downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is waiting in the front hallway. She's heavily made-up and dressed in a predictably sexy outfit. She dangles a set of car keys in front of Needy and CHIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess who's got the whip `til 11:30? A 2003 Chrysler Sebring and it's all mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky you get to ride with me to the club in style!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does a sexy little dance in the doorway, then notices CHIP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi Chip. Do you like puppies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs her boobs and thrusts her chest outward at him, giggling. Needy watches jealously and MANEUVERS HER WAY IN FRONT OF JENNIFER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you forgot, like, two buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she remembered two buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer sniffs the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It smells like Thai food in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you guys been fucking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gross!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shoves Jennifer and they begin wrestling playfully. CHIP slumps against the wall, staring awestruck at Jennifer's cleavage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's go to the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of them shuffle onto the porch. Needy locks the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Carousel is not a club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat my ass, Chip. You're just jello `cause you're not invited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not jello! That place is gross. Everyone there has a mustache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're totally jello! You're lime green jello and you can't even admit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls scamper toward the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after them) Stop kidnapping my girlfriend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAROUSEL is a run-down tavern at the edge of town, the kind with NASCAR posters, wobbly chairs and strands of plastic pennants crisscrossing the ceiling. It's a busy night and the bar is teeming with locals. A bartender sells a CASE OF BEER to a customer and passes it over the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip was right. The Carousel is definitely not a club. Clubs are for attractive people in populous urban areas. Clubs have DJs and champagne and separate bathrooms for guys and girls. All we have is a broken jukebox, a few domestic taps and the Sticker Toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a lone, nasty-looking TOILET covered in BAND STICKERS.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON NEEDY
dialogues.text: Needy and Jennifer enter the bar. Every guy in the joint stares at Jennifer, who snaps her "MINOR" wristband distastefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I can't wait until I'm old enough to get wasted. Have you ever had peach schnapps?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peach schnapps are excellent. They even taste good when they come out of your nose mid-puke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A teenage guy, CRAIG, passes by and waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Jennifer. You look nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without enthusiasm) What up, Craig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She elbows Needy and makes a GAGGING GESTURE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thinks he's cute enough for me. No wonder he's in retard math.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer pulls out a pack of Camel Wides and lights one awkwardly. Needy notices AHMET FROM INDIA, a FOREIGN EXCHANGE STUDENT, standing by himself away from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's Ahmet from India. The foreign exchange guy. He's all by himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we traded a cute hockey player for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems okay. He's got that cool elephant statue in his locker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he's circumcised? I always wanted to try sea cucumber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ew!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROMAN DUDA saunters up to Jennifer, swigging a bottle of beer. He snatches the pack of cigarettes away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're smoking dicks now, Jen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I like the Wides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sticks the fat cigarette between her lips and inhales pointedly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just bet you do. I should arrest you for possession under the legal age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrest me, pfft! You're not even out of the academy yet, Roman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two more months and I'm on the force for real. Then I'll be able to cuff you whenever the hell I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grips her wrist and twists it behind her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How will I wait that long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She paws Roman's crotch discreetly. Needy winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here, babe. I gotta keep my nose clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, there's the band!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of skinny INDIE ROCK BOYS are setting up their equipment on a pathetically tiny stage-- it's more like a dais. The LEAD SINGER has intense, spooky eyes, nearly obscured by a shock of hair. The locals, mostly good ol' boys, eye the band suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell they're from the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, `cause they look like a bunch of faygos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would think that. You're such a small-time Gomer. I wish we had more guys like that in Devil's Kettle. All stylish and shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy nods dumbly. She stares at the band, awestruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look so-- so cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gazes at the stage, hearing only the whistling rush of ARCTIC AIR. In SLOW MOTION, the GUITARIST unsheathes his Fender Jaguar from its gig bag. He notices her staring and runs the tip of his tongue over his lips. Needy swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I think they need two groupies. Come on! It'll be like Almost Famous! I'll be Penny Lane and you can be the other girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs Needy's hand and enthusiastically tries to drag her toward the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be J.V., Needy. They're just boys. Morsels. We have all the power, don't you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She plants her hands on Needy's CHEST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things are like smart bombs. Point `em in the right direction and shit gets real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy shrugs free of Jennifer's grasp and follows her reluctantly across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lead singer of Soft Shoulder, NIKOLAI WOLF, is already striding forward to meet them at the lip of the stage. His gait is as smooth as his shock of dyed-black hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Um, we just really wanted to meet you or something? I'm Jennifer Check and this is my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Nikolai Wolf, and this is my band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches down and pumps Jennifer's outstretched hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Soft Shoulder, right? I've heard you guys are super, super good at playing your instruments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope we can live up to such...high praise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, if you don't mind me asking, why did you want to play all the way out here in Devil's Kettle? You live in the city, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But I think it's so important to connect with our fans in rural areas. Plus, the audiences in small towns really appreciate us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I show you my appreciation right now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy looks at the floor, embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer's voice scales up nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, I'll buy you a drink? I mean, I'll see if I can get you a drink. They make this great 9/11 tribute shooter? It's red, white and blue, but you have to drink it fast or it gets all brownish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer hurries off toward the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy moves self-consciously into a nearby corner, not wanting to continue the conversation with Nikolai alone. A LOCAL plugs a Loretta Lynn tune into the jukebox, with a challenging stare at the band. A DRUNK COUPLE begins two-stepping in front of the stage. Nikolai walks up to the guitar player, DIRK, and pulls him aside. Needy pricks up her ears and listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirk, what about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing to Needy) Who, Training Bra Jones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy looks offended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the hot one. The one who just walked away. She's it, man. She's exactly what we're looking for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure she's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a kid. We're in God's country, man. Everyone out here's a fundie bible-banger. Of course she's a virgin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirk hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirk, we didn't haul our asses out to this corn palace for nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Okay. You know, I know I'm not "just the bassist." I'm a person who happens to play the bass guitar. And I would like some respect...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai is already ignoring him. Needy, alarmed, emerges from her hiding place and discreetly rushes over to the bar where Jennifer is arguing with a jealous-looking Roman. He shakes his head in disgust and leaves the bar. Jennifer walks over holding an ostentatious PATRIOTIC THEMED DRINK. She laughs when she sees Needy's concerned expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Are you scared of rock stars too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those guys are rank, Jen. Just forget about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the singer wants me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only because he thinks you're a virgin. I heard them talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right! I'm not even a backdoor-virgin anymore, thanks to Roman. By the way, that hurts. I couldn't even go to flags the next day. I had to stay home and sit on a bag of frozen peas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if Nikolai wants innocent, I can do innocent. I'll be Little Miss Fucking Sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's way too old for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't cock-block me, Needy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piercing FEEDBACK signals the beginning of the set. Nikolai takes the mic and smiles broadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, Devil's Lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone in the back shouts "Devil's Kettle!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Anyway, we're Soft Shoulder. And we just want to make you happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He WINKS at Jennifer. The band launch into the same intense, soaring song we heard in the COP CAR and the HOLE. Jennifer's eyes never leave Nikolai's. She's hypnotized, clinging to Needy's arm. Even the locals look charmed. Suddenly, a lick of FLAME appears on the wood paneling next to the stage. Needy is the first to notice. As she watches in horror, the fire is reflected in her glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flames quickly climbs up to the ceiling and begin to blaze uncontrollably. People SCREAM and scatter. Someone ineffectually tries to throw a pitcher of beer on the fire. Nikolai turns and sees the fire spreading. He and Chas exchange glances. The BASS PLAYER pitches his guitar aside and jumps off the stage, and the drummer abandons his kit. Nikolai seems perfectly cool and composed as he watches from the stage...is he smiling? CHAOS. Everyone is trying to get out of the bar at once, causing a stampede. A woman's clothes and hair CATCH FIRE and she falls to her knees. We see a BEAM fall from the roof, nearly killing AHMET FROM INDIA. Jennifer stands still in a dreamlike state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jennifer) I know where to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy grabs Jennifer by the elbow and pulls her into the tiny BATHROOM. Choking on smoke, they climb onto the Sticker Toilet (which now sports a giant SOFT SHOULDER sticker on the tank) and boost each other out the BATHROOM WINDOW. Hundreds are still trapped inside, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer collapses in Needy's arms, coughing. Needy hugs her fiercely, almost romantically. She cups Jennifer's flushed face and looks into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so hot, Needy. I think I'm on fire. Oh God, I'm burning!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're okay, I promise. You got burned worse when you wore that tin-foil bikini to the beach. Everything's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a HAND clamps onto Jennifer's shoulder. Both girls jump. It's Nikolai, his forehead creased with false concern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you girls all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy is less than thrilled to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're great. Maybe you should try to find your band?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those guys? They were the first ones out the door. Ran for the van like a bunch of Marys. Frankly, I'm ashamed of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy narrows her eyes suspiciously. Muffled SCREAMS rise up from the flame-engulfed building. Jennifer covers her ears and cowers, sweat rolling down her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, it feels like hell out here. Come and hang with us in the van for a while, just until they hose this place down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slumps against Nikolai's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in shock. Here, drink this. You'll feel better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smoothly retrieves a plastic bottle of PEACH SCHNAPPS from his coat and holds it to Jennifer's lips. She swigs it cooperatively, dribbling down her chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy blinks in disbelief at the coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you a little freaked out about this? What about all your stuff? It's probably melting, and when you get to the next stop you'll have to do like, a crappy acoustic set! Nobody likes that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be able to afford new gear soon enough. I have a feeling we're gonna blow up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see your van. C'mon Needy, let's go to the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Why should we? We have the Malibu. Let's just get out of here. We can go to El Ojo and get Northwoods Nachos with extra Badger Sauce! Please? I'm starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy, stop it. Just stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She defiantly follows Nikolai toward the WHITE VAN, which is parked a suspiciously safe distance from the bar. Needy staggers after them slowly, watching. Behind Needy, the bar EXPLODES. Screams. Flames. Silence. Needy doesn't even look back as she watches Jennifer get into the van. Ash drifts into her hair like snowflakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai takes off his shirt as he enters the van, revealing his slick, muscled white torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched her get into that van and I knew something awful was going to happen. But for some reason, I felt drawn toward them. Toward him. He was pale and twisted and evil, like this petrified tree I saw when I was a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see LITTLE NEEDY, about five years old, staring up at a petrified tree in the darkness, horrified yet compelled. The tree seems to stoop forward, cracking...

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON NEEDY
dialogues.text: Needy's face is fixed in the same haunted expression. Nikolai turns to look at her, his teeth bared in a vicious smile. Needy turns and sprints off in the opposite direction, away from the van and the fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy stumbles into her bedroom, overwhelmed. Her clothes are smoke damaged and her cheeks are sooty. She grabs her cheap, taped-up cell phone and dials CHIP's number shakily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip's bedroom is pitch black until a cheap cell phone lights up under the covers illuminating his sleeping form, clad only in jockey shorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Niedermeyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God you're there. I hoped you were sleeping with your phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer's gone. She ran off with that rock band. And the Carousel burned down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP sits bolt upright

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, burned down? To the ground? Is everyone okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I think they're mostly dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. You're okay, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went out the bathroom window. Everyone else was trying to use the door. It was like a stampede. The people who fainted got run over and you could hear their bones breaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was all this screaming and popping, like a million Black Cats all going off at once. And the smell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is real, right? This isn't just, like, some crazy dream like last time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Anyway, it took me like an hour to walk home. But Jennifer's still with those creeps! They had one of those white molester vans with no windows. The back was all blacked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares about Jennifer and those douchebags with douchebag haircuts? People just burned to death. In our town!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DOORBELL chimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh cheese and fries! Someone's here. I'm alone, Chip. I'm freaked out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swing shift. Listen, I'll call you in a minute. Stay awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holla back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy hangs up the phone and rushes downstairs. As she passes through the shadowy kitchen, appliances HUM all around her. The silence is menacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy opens the door. Nobody there. She slams the door, turns around and SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is standing in the dark hallway, looking ghostly pale and smiling. Her clothes are tattered and stained-- her entire front is soaked in blood. Her makeup is smeared, and her eyes are bruised and sunken like a zombie's. She looks HORRIFYING, especially with that ghastly, clownish grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Jennifer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer says nothing and continues to smile with blood- tinged teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Utter silence. Then a dripping sound. Needy looks down and sees large drops of blood spattering the linoleum. Jennifer continues to smile, staring directly at Needy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J-Jen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer lets out a horrifying banshee SCREAM, wailing at the top of her lungs. She vomits a torrent of evil- looking black bile all over herself and Needy and staggers wildly down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bloody black bile hits the wall, splashing a framed school portrait of Needy. Needy screams and watches in horror as it slides down the wall. The bile has hundred of tiny SPINES sticking out of it, like little porcupine needles, and it appears to move by itself, oozing across the linoleum, creeping into the corners. It's truly revolting. Needy grabs Jennifer blindly and claps a hand over her mouth. Jennifer falls to her knees, her screams turning to jagged, insane laughter. Needy tries to run, but Jennifer grabs her and THROWS her against the wall with superhuman force, pinning her. Jennifer slowly, tantalizingly brushes her face against Needy's hair, her earlobe. Needy doesn't move a muscle. Jennifer's hand slides up Needy's ribcage. She presses her lips against Needy's carotid artery. We hear Needy's blood pumping, swishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy nods. Jennifer parts her lips. Then suddenly, she stops and PULLS AWAY, pushing Needy to the floor. Jennifer bolts out the front door and takes off running down the street. Needy is motionless for a moment, then stumbles toward the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming after her) Jennifer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moments before the first morning bell. Needy is sitting at her desk in English class, still visibly bruised from her scuffle with Jennifer the night before. She looks like she hasn't slept a wink. The mood is quiet and somber-- kids whisper about the fire and gather in groups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard Needy and Jennifer were there and they had to fight their way out with a machete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, she's not even moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called Post Traumatic Stress Disorder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a figure steps in front of Needy. It's JENNIFER, looking absolutely gorgeous-- and remarkably unscathed. She smiles brightly at Needy as if nothing happened the night before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Friday!, D-bag!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You-- you're all right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why wouldn't I be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night. At my house. You were hurt. You had two black eyes and blood everywhere and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy, you're delusional. I got a little banged up when you made me go out that window, but I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had to go out that window. The bar was like, engulfed in flames!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do have a tendency to overreact. Remember at Girl Scout camp when you thought there was an earthquake and it was really just two guys with a ghetto blaster?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot of people died, Jennifer. They burned to death, or they choked, or they just got trampled. More than half of the people there didn't make it out. It's like, all over the news. National news. Kids are dead. Parents are dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone we know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know everyone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sucks to be them, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She giggles and reaches for her knockoff designer purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it. What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer applies lip gloss and smacks her lips together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with you? I mean, besides the obvious surface flaws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy rubs her eyes, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself) There's no way I dreamed it. No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down at her hands. There's DRIED BLOOD under her fingernails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her blood was still under my nails. See, I'd been up all night scrubbing the carnage off the linoleum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Needy on her hands and knees in the eerie blue light of dawn, sobbing as she diligently scrubs blood and bile off the floor with a dirty sponge. The black, spiny vomit repulses her, and she gags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches for a Swiffer WetJet mop and pulls the trigger. No solution comes out. She curses, hysterical and sleep-deprived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work, you...twat! Swiff, darn it! Swiff! Swiff!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She collapses in tears on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly, to herself) Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk to yourself. It's one of your more freakish Needy behaviors and it makes us both look like total gaylords.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy raises her hands desperately to Jennifer, spreading her fingers to display her filthy fingernails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eww, you need a mani bad. You'd better find a Chinese chick to buff your situation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. WROBLEWSKI, a middle-aged teacher, enters the room. He has a gnarly-looking robotic hand and moves awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes Handi-Snack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wroblewski clears his throat. His voice quavers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure those of you who made it here today have all heard the news. It's a dark day for Devil's Kettle, a day we can never, ever forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A single, stifled sob rises from the class. Needy glances around the room and sees students fighting back tears. A huge JOCK weeps openly, tears spattering his swimsuit- model decorated notebook. Jennifer smirks, barely able to contain her laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The administration here has decided that today will be a unstructured day of support and remembrance. We've lost nine precious students-- including Ahmet from India-- several parents, and a teacher, Ms. Parrish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fights back tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way! Parrish ate shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy shushes her, appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This tragedy is obviously beyond anything we can measure. More than ever, we need to band together and draw strength from each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wroblewski painstakingly retrieves a tissue from his pocket with his robotic hand and dabs at his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (his voice cracking) We can rise up. We can overcome death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy eyes Jennifer warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jock collapses in sobs. A tiny, acne-scarred GEEK leans over and folds the jock into an unlikely hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh look, they're united in grief. That'll last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The automated bell rings. Needy slings on her backpack and hurries over to CHIP's locker. He's packing up a pair of drum mallets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No band practice today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No anything today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's surreal, right? I mean, when just one guy dies in Devil's Kettle, it's like time stops. And now so many people are dead, nobody knows when it's okay to start again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel guilty just breathing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip, I need to tell you something kind of weird. It's about Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know last night when we were talking and someone came to my door? That was Jennifer. But she didn't talk. She just stood there, smiling at me, but a bad kind of smile. She looked like she'd been beat up or shot or something. She was all bloody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then she barfed up this disgusting prickly stuff that was like roadkill and sewing needles all mixed together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shudders at the memory

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuck. Like those porcupine meatballs my mom makes with the rice sticking out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, like almost that bad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP and Needy ponder the grotesque image in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was probably because she inhaled a whole bunch of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It was something evil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might want    to talk to the school shrink,    Needy. I'm not saying that to    be a dillhole. I'm actually kinda    concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip, I'm a National Merit Scholar. I don't tell whoppers and I'm not crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say you were crazy. It's just that everyone's a little messed up about this. It's okay to feel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Discombobulated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you know. Fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they prepare to leave, COLIN GRAY approaches Needy. He's a cute PUNK/GOTH guy wearing black nail polish, a lip ring, and full wardrobe by Hot Topic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Needy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip blatantly scoots closer to Needy, eyeing Colin suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Hi, Colin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you were there last night. In the fiery trenches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm glad you made it out. Really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin walks away. Chip looks jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you friends with Colin Gray? I thought Colin Gray only talked to the Dead Girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a group of GOTH GIRLS splayed against their lockers in full regalia. One wears an ACCORDION for no reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just am. We have Composition together. He's a really good writer. You know-- he's so dark and emotional and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I can relate. I'm also like that, even if I'm not all obvious about it like a poseur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk me home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONAS KOZELLE, the JOCK we saw sobbing earlier, is standing at the deserted football field.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It's a gray, overcast fall day and the wind whistles eerily through the trees. The football is set back a good a distance from the school, and Jonas is all alone. In the distance, a tiny figure slowly approaches, It starts a dot on the horizon. As it draws closer, we see it's JENNIFER. Her bright, lipsticked grin is eerie and unmistakable. Jonas glances briefly over his right shoulder, indifferent. A few seconds later, he glances again. Strangely, Jennifer ISN'T THERE. Jennifer suddenly appears on Jonas's left side, startling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Hey, Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm crazy-sorry about your profound loss. You are crying about Craig, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was my best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer puts her arm around him sympathetically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I was close to him too. You know, I was there last night in that horrible place. I saw Craig a few minutes before the fire broke out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You-- you did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I was probably the last person to talk to him. Like, ever. Literally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we got to talking about you, actually. And do you know what he said? He said you were like a brother to him. Not a bro. An actual brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas's lip trembles as he unsuccessfully fights back tears. Jennifer cuddles closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choking up) I just can't believe he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you know what else Craig said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. It's too intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Please, Jen, you've gotta tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he said he always thought you and me would make a totally bangin' couple. Isn't that so weird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said bangin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer reaches for Jonas's hand and slides it slowly up her shirt, placing it on her left breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel my heart, Jonas. I think it's broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choking up) Mine too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me. Just for a while. We'll help each other get through this nightmare. It's what Craig would have wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jonas nods dumbly, brainwashed. Jennifer leads him away from the field, toward the WOODS bordering the school campus. They vanish into the woods. In the distance, we see the FALLS rushing into the lake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy and Chip are walking home from school, still deep in discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole night must be a total blur, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the thing, it's not a blur at all! I remember everything, in like ultra-high-def detail. The band, the fire, everything. Especially what happened after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "After" is the part I don't really get, to be honest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I need someone to believe me. Jennifer was-- she was destroyed. She was dying in my hallway, Chip. I saw. I used my CPR training to check her pulse. And I felt her dying, on the inside, I mean. I've known her so long that it's like sometimes I can feel what she feels. We're like E.T. and Elliot Ness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip takes Needy's hand and squeezes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Chipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer and Jonas are in the woods. Jennifer efficiently whips off her top and bra and begins kissing Jonas hungrily. As Jonas touches her, he recoils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel so warm. Why are you so warm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly covering his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutties!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls off Jonas' shirt and digs her nails into his arms, kissing him with renewed ferocity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woods are dead silent. A few squirrels approach the clearing, and Jonas watches them warily with one open eye as Jennifer kisses him. Then a deer wanders into the clearing. Then a fox. The animals pause in their tracks and watch, motionless. It's an eerie, unnatural tableau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Animals continue to gather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer! Jen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures to the ANIMALS, who are watching, still as statues. A few crows alight on a nearby tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm. They're waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer unzips Jonas's jeans and smiles, reaching down and working him with her hand. Jonas moans, still eyeing the animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you miss Craig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. You're going to see your buddy again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like in heaven someday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and shakes her head. Jonas jerks back, creeped out. He tries to pull away from Jennifer, but she's too strong. She PINS him to the tree. We see her jaw begin to UNHINGE, like some horrible snake. Her eyes cloud over with blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A horrible SCREAM of agony rises from the woods. Mr. Wroblewski is exiting the school, briefcase in hand. He stops in his tracks when he hears the scream. He shakes his head sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) God, they're feeling so much pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another scream, this time weaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it all out, kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for his Ford Festiva, then pauses as if thinking better of it. Something isn't right. He puts his keys back in his pocket and walks toward the woods to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy is preparing herself a fried bologna sandwich in the kitchen. Needy's ALBINO FERRET chases a ball across the cracked floor. Needy scrapes the sandwich out of the skillet and takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fried bologna is the bomb! (to ferret) You want some, Greedo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tuns on the kitchen radio and is surprised to hear a very familiar song: "Through the Trees," by Soft Shoulder. Suddenly, she pauses, a look of UNEASE and even FEAR crossing her face. She stops and braces herself against the counter, her KNEES SHAKING. Something isn't right. She drops the sandwich. Greedo goes straight for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Needy sinks to her knees, she stares straight ahead at the REFRIGERATOR. A photo magnet of JENNIFER leers back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes. A brief, near-subliminal FLASH of the carnage in the woods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song ends, snapping Needy out of her reverie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was Soft Shoulder, the local band who became the unlikely heroes of the tragedy in Devil's Kettle last night. Eyewitnesses say the boys helped numerous people escape the inferno, risking their own lives in the process. That's rock n' roll with a conscience, ladies and gentlemen. Had a lot of requests for that one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wroblewski ventures into the woods, heading toward the clearing. At first, we can only hear mysterious sounds-- scratching and smacking. Birds and animals are closely gathered in a circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Mr. Wroblewski clutches his arm and gags, realizing the animals are feeding on a huge CARCASS. A BADGER looks up, its snout soaked in blood. Mr. Wroblewski begins to scream. The animals scatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A glimpse of the CORPSE: It's Jonas, of course. His entire torso has been torn open, exposing his ribs and guts. Blood and viscera everywhere, INTESTINES strewn about the forest floor like party streamers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Virgin Mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wroblewski falls to his knees, hollering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy is seated at the kitchen table. She accidentally drops the remains of her sandwich on the floor, where the ferret quickly pillages it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy's mom, ANTONIA "TONI" LESNICKI, has quietly entered the kitchen in her pajamas. She's pale and sweaty, as if she's been spooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, Mom. I didn't know you were awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just had one of my night terrors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's four o' clock, so technically you had a day terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, right. I'm all mixed up since I started working swing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you dream about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dreamed some bad people were trying to nail me to a tree with hammers and big stakes and shit. Just like Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She crosses herself piously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were trying to get to you too, but I wouldn't let `em. I'm a hard-assed, Ford-tough mama bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like, don't y'all touch my daughter. I'll piss on you like Calvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I can take care of myself, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you think. One of these days you're gonna be crying out for me and I might not be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Mom? Did you get a chance to catch the news after you clocked out this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I just did my scratch tickets, snorted a few Lunesta and went straight to bed. Is something going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't nothing happen in Devil's Kettle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches the FERRET skitter across the kitchen floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anita, that ferret stinks. He needs to be washed from craw to cornhole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toni shakes her head and heads upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hysterical SCREAM pierces the twilight. The sun has begun to set. An ambulance and four police cars have pulled up near the woods, which are cordoned off with yellow police tape. Near the woods, JONAS'S PARENTS are crying. His MOTHER screams and begins beating the ground with her fists. A stretcher is being loaded into the ambulance. OFFICER WARZAK exits one of the police cruisers. Her signature giant poofy bangs are in full effect. She rushes to comfort Jonas's bereaved mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We will get the man that did this to your son. You hear me? We'll get that sick M.F.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get him myself! I will! You hear me, you bastard? I'll cut off your nutsack and nail it to my door! Like one of those lion doorknockers rich folks got! That'll be your balls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of Jonas's parents screaming carries across the lake. The water is eerily calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a HEAD breaks the surface of the lake. It's Jennifer, gliding through the water. She looks calm and serene. The SCREAMING continues across the lake. The sirens, shouting and chaos contrast sharply with this peaceful scene. Jennifer paddles to the shore and hoists herself onto the pier, naked and dripping wet. She runs her tongue over her teeth briefly and nonchalantly picks something out from between her two front teeth, like she's just finished a delicious rib dinner. Jennifer wrings out her sopping hair and reaches for her clothes, which are neatly folded on the pier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once she's dressed, she walks off into the woods, as if nothing out of the ordinary has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy is sitting at her lamp-lit desk, reading an old E.C. horror comic and eating a banana. The phone rings. Needy picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer's hair is still wet from the lake, but she's changed into shorts and a tank top. Music blasts from her stereo. She admires herself in the mirror, popping her ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel sooo scrumptious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up a Soft Shoulder button and POKES her arm hard with the pin without flinching. Blood spurts from the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, like when you kiss a hot guy for the first time and your whole body feels like it's on vibrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's that good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer gazes at her arm, transfixed. She wipes the blood away-- the wound has magically DISAPPEARED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucky you. See, I'm still kind of depressed about, you know, the giant smoldering funeral pyre in the middle of town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move-on dot org, Needy! It's over. Life's too short to mope over some white-trash pig roast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flicks a Zippo lighter and touches the FLAME to her tongue-- first tentatively, then confidently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell it like it is. Besides, you should be happy for me. I'm having the best day since, like Jesus invented the calendar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus didn't invent the calendar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer giggles maniacally and sighs with happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy's call-waiting beeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my other line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So blow it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She casually lights her HAIR on fire. The flames leap up, then die down, leaving her entirely untouched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll just be a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooh. I'm crossing you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She draws a mini-X in the air. Needy clicks over. It's CHIP. We get a nice trifold pie- chart illustrating the intersecting calls. CHIP is panicked and sweaty in his living room. In the background, Chip's little sister CAMILLE bangs on a piano. Red police lights flash outside the picture window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see you right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can barely hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille is playing piano. Knock it off, Camille!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knock it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you meet me at McCullum in ten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knock it off, Chip! You're penis cheese!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back on JENNIFER: Jennifer is impatiently dragging a razor down her arm. Blood drips onto the rug. She smiles, in awe of herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy clicks back over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could possibly be more important than me and my godlike powers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to meet Chip at McCullum Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip is looking cute to me lately. So tell me, is he packing some serious pubic inches? What's the story down there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy hangs up the phone abruptly and grabs one of her many cardigan sweaters, heading for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The park is dark and tree-lined and appears to be a popular clandestine meeting spot for the youth of Devil's Kettle. The abandoned sand volleyball pits are full of couples making out. Needy runs past them skittishly. As she ascends a grassy hill, CHIP is revealed, silhouetted against a backdrop of twirling police lights. Needy squints at the lights, sees CHIP's house in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are the cops at your house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not. They're at Jonas Kozelle's house. He got murdered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Like, he was shot by gangbangers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Needy! Do you see anyone rollin' on dubs around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone ripped Jonas limb from limb in the woods behind the school. Ate parts of him. They found teethmarks on him-- on the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice cracks. We see a brief, terrifying FLASH of Jonas's mutilated body and pain-stricken face. Needy doesn't want to believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some animals must've got to him.
