dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Human teethmarks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It just happened after school. No one's supposed to know yet, but my dad went over there and talked to the cops. Jonas's mom is catatonic. She's just staring out the front window like a zombie mannequin robot statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be a coincidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, Needy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fiery death trap last night, and now a cannibal eats our starting tight-end? Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get spooky on me, babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously Chip. Most small towns only have something gruesome happen like, once every decade maybe. Devil's Kettle gets two nightmares in 24 hours? It's freaktarded. It's not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, do you think it's, like supernatural?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I'm extremely intelligent but I obviously don't know everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the bad luck's gotta be over now, right? It can't get any worse, right? Obviously it can't. It can't. I mean, you agree, right? There won't be another victim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cold. It's very cold out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want my sweater?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pink is cool. Rap guys wear pink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's shaking now, too. Chip leans forward and kisses her. She closes her eyes. In the chaste space between CHIP and Needy's bodies, the volleyball-pit couple fuck like rabbits.

dialogues.speaker: A SERIES OF NEWSPAPER HEADLINES
dialogues.text: The familiar Soft Shoulder ballad plays as we see a dreamy montage of headlines. The headline of the Devil's Kettle Sun-Post simply reads:

dialogues.speaker: "WHY
dialogues.text: The headline of the Minneapolis Star Tribune reads: "'BUTCHERED': Devil's Kettle youth brutally murdered in wake of devastating fire."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smaller headline on the front page of the New York Times reads: "Minnesota town rocked by grisly murder, blaze."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were famous. We were saints. Our town's only bar had burned to the ground and our star quarterback was somebody's Quarter Pounder. The whole country got a huge tragedy boner for Devil's Kettle. And the press-- God, they couldn't get enough of our little world of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Devil's Kettle citizens holding a tearful candlelight vigil by the former Carousel site. They softly sing along with the Soft Shoulder song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the trees, I will find you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see weeping students shoving flowers through the slats of Jonas' abandoned locker. The hallway floor is covered with teddy bears and bouquets. We see the PASSING OF TIME as the bouquets wilt and the blooms droop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pile of discarded scratch-off tickets next to Needy's mother's bed grows steadily as the days go by. Another Star Tribune headline. This one reads: "Two weeks later, cannibal killer still at large." A smaller subhead reads "ARTS: Local band Soft Shoulder sign to major."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The days marched on as usual, but most of us were too numb to enjoy ourselves. Most of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jennifer cheerfully skipping down the school hallway in a sleazy Technicolor outfit. The rest of the kids look grey, ashen and depressed, but Jennifer pops like a Roman candle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, we were healing. Like CHIP, we figured things could only get better. We had faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see clusters of cautiously optimistic kids in the school courtyard. They smile, then laugh, as if they're re-learning how to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were fucking idiots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late September. Leaves are beginning to drift off trees. The surrounding woods are still blocked off with yellow police tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wroblewski stands solemnly in front of the class, his mechanical hand tensing and releasing nervously. Needy and the rest of the class fidget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before the period ends, I have an announcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you know, this is the one month anniversary of the Carousel fire and also the murder of Jonas Kozelle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bo-ring!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jennifer. She looks haggard, thin, and cranky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I feel like boo-boo. My skin is breaking out. My hair is dull and lifeless. God, it's like I'm one of the normal girls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy smooths her own hair self-consciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you PMS-ing or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PMS isn't real, Needy. It was invented by the boy-run media to make us seem crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wroblewski clears his throat, annoyed by their talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...As I was saying, Needy and Jennifer, I finally have some good news to share with all of you. The members of the rock group Soft Shoulder have decided to extend a helping hand to our community.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ripple of excitement in the room. A girl seated in the front row is wearing a Soft Shoulder T-SHIRT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you know, their song "Through the Trees" has become our unofficial anthem of unity and healing. So, they've decided to release it as a benefit single.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3% of the profits will go to local families who have been affected by loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class is happily abuzz-- except Needy, who looks appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the other 97%?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other 97%. I mean, that's just crass. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks around for support, finding none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crass. It means scummy. Greedy. Am I the only one who actually does the vocab drills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHASTITY, the girl in the Soft Shoulder T-shirt, turns to face Needy angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soft Shoulder are American heroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they're not. I was there, Chastity. They didn't actually help anyone escape the fire. I don't even know how that rumor got started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rumor?! RUMOR? It's true! It's on their Wikipedia page!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's crap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GIRLS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've milked our pain-- our loss- - to get a stupid record deal! No one would even know who they were if they hadn't been playing here that night. They used us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (growling, almost

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You take that back, Needy Lesnicki! We need them now more then ever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BELL rings. Students get up and gather their books for the next period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy and Jennifer slowly head toward their respective lockers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm already sick of that song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's poorly produced. Could the bass be any lower in the mix?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offense, but you look kind of drained. Is everything all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine. It's just, like, wearing off or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wearing off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you on pot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, dick ridge! Just forget I said anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLIN GRAY, the punk/goth boy we met earlier, approaches Jennifer nervously as she exits the classroom. Needy drops behind them, eavesdropping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Needy) Hi. (to Jennifer, more

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey Colin. Listen, can I copy your bio lab again? I never got around to dissecting that kitten fetus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Actually, I sort of wanted to ask you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. You want to know if I'll go out with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Well-- yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go ahead with the pitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin fidgets awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we've been having a lot of fun in class, you and I, and I just thought maybe we could go to a movie or something. There's a midnight showing of Rocky Horror at the Bijou next weekend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like boxing movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not...fuck it. Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to walk down the hallway, dejected. Jennifer watches him leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just come by my place tonight? I just got Aquamarine on DVD. It's about this girl who's like, half-sushi. I guess she has sex through her blowhole or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Great! Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll text you my address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin walks away, grinning triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was random.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm used to guys asking me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin's a really nice guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's into maggot-rock. He wears nail polish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip appears behind Needy and drapes his arm over her shoulder. Needy jumps, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy puts her arm around Chip protectively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go parlez French. Slam you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Needy) Talking to your good pal Colin Gray again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He was just asking Jennifer out on a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip looks relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I come over tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. I'd like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to Super Target and bought more condoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that that has anything to do with my coming over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't assume that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll see you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy waves as Chip walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin Gray drives down the street in a big old boat of a classic car. He's blasting punk music on an iPod that's been rigged to the ancient AM radio. Colin holds up his CELL PHONE to re-read the directions Jennifer texted him. The street is extremely dark and silent, occupied only by a new townhouse development. The identical units still appear to be under construction. There aren't even any streetlights. The plastic sheeting over the windows flaps eerily in the breeze. Colin's brow furrows in confusion-- it doesn't even look like anyone lives here yet. He checks the phone display again.

dialogues.speaker: PHONE
dialogues.text: The TEXT MESSAGE reads: "trn lft on camerford and your there. first house on rt. 1004 camerford. C-ya! xoxo jen"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure enough, the house number is 1004. Colin throws the car into park and walks up to the porch. He looks up and notices a glow coming from an upstairs window,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin presses the doorbell. Nothing happens-- the house isn't wired for electricity yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy and CHIP are kissing on Chip's water bed. Chip fumbles for one of those "fragrance plug-ins" and PLUGS it into the wall. Needy looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For ambiance. It's Jammin' Jasmine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom has Holiday Scents too, if you're interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, this is nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin enters the house tentatively. It's dark, vacant, and very creepy. There's a very faint glow and soft music coming from upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stumbles over a stray 2 x 4. There are piles of sawdust and building materials everywhere-- the house is definitely still under construction. Colin looks confused. A MOUSE skitters over his sneakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer? Anyone there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music upstairs grows slightly louder in response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin squares his shoulders and heads slowly up the creaking stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy has eased off her top to reveal an endearingly plain white bra, complete with center bow. CHIP, also shirtless, cops a feel. He reaches into his pocket and pulls out a fluorescent orange CONDOM. Needy looks at the wrapper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Sensual Swirl?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's supposed to make it feel good for the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin follows the music into an empty bedroom. The dark room is filled with blazing candles melting and pooling into bizarre shapes. A single BLANKET is spread out on the floor. Colin shivers. Behind him, in the doorway, Jennifer appears, her smiling face hellishly aglow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? This isn't really your house, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No baby. This is our house, just for you and me. We can play Mommy and Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin is totally dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you even know my last name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silly. I've been sending you signals all year. Couldn't you tell? You give me such a wettie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts KISSING Colin on the neck. We can see confusion-- and fear-- in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip fumbles below his waist, obviously struggling with the condom. Needy leans forward for a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. It's got little bumps on it. I can hardly wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer grips Colin's face in her hands and forcibly kisses him on the mouth. Colin succumbs, but stiffly. We hear a SCRATCHING noise. Colin pulls away instinctively and sees MICE and ROACHES emerging from the walls, skittering over surfaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer looks over her shoulder and giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared? I thought boys like you were into vermin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unbuttons his jeans. They fall noisily to the floor-- they're the baggy Hot Topic kind with chains and buckles galore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice hardware, Ace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin into Jennifer's eyes. There's something horrible about her face...like she's become almost corpselike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't you dare pass out! I need you to be conscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin tries to jerk away, but Jennifer easily disengages his arm from its socket. A sickeningly moist SNAP. Colin cries out in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slams him to the ground and mounts him. Her jaw unhinges, opening her mouth to a horrifying, inhuman degree. Her teeth are razor-sharp and grotesquely crowded, like they belong to some horribly deformed dog. She descends on him, feeding ravenously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see their shadows against the wall: Jennifer lunging hungrily, blood spraying up from Colin's jugular. We can hear him screaming and gargling on his own blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP is doggedly pumping away on top of Needy, his eyes closed in concentration. Needy's vacant eyes are suddenly brimming with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopeless..hopeless...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP opens his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Am I hurting you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy starts weeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I too big?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears roll down Needy's cheeks. She begins moaning, then SCREAMING at that top of her lungs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hallucinates liquid seeping through the walls, blood and lymph oozing in at the corners and windows. Then the infamous spiny black bile... Pixelated nightmares emerge from the darkness. Skulls, jesters, demons, death. It's the worst acid trip imaginable. Needy rubs her eyes frantically and continues to scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP immediately rolls off Needy, concerned. He grabs her and tries to shake some sense into her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy! What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy continues to shriek hysterically, her voice growing ragged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can still hear Colin making inhuman sounds of pain. We can only see the carnage in shadow, but it's clearly unspeakable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy clutches her throat, hyperventilating. She stands up and struggles to get dressed. Her breath rasps. Chip is freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it something I did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need more foreplay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin's thrashing limbs finally go limp. Jennifer is hunched over his remains like a jackal scooping blood into her mouth with cupped hands. We see his eyes, flecked with blood, pupils dilated. A white MOUSE crawls over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy races toward the door with Chip in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go. I'm sorry. I just... feel like something...something terrible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel-- What does that even mean? I'm worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, Chip. I'm so sorry. Everything is just wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bolts out the room, leaving Chip naked and alone. He pulls his knees up to his chest, vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy runs toward her mom's CAR, a beat-up Kia parked on the curb. She climbs into the car and starts the ignition, trembling and crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out onto the street and guns it. She swings a hard left. The streets are all almost identical, lined by working-class homes. She turns on the radio. The song is, of course, "Through the Trees" by Soft Shoulder. She pounds the dashboard, hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fudge! Fudge! Maple fudge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy seizes the wheel drives recklessly down a dark, tree-lined street. Then, she sees something bright emerge from the shadows. Her eyes widen... It's JENNIFER, creeping toward the curb like an animal. She's pale in the moonlight. The entire lower half of her face is covered in blood, like a ghoulish beard of gore. She flashes a huge, deranged, toothy SMILE at Needy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy screams and SWERVES. The car fishtails out of control and slides into a ditch. Needy slams her foot onto the accelerator, trying to get out of the trench. She glances desperately out the side window. Jennifer is gone. Panting, Needy tries to accelerate again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Jennifer appears from out of nowhere and SLAMS her body against the windshield, her long limbs splayed like an insect's. The windshield SHATTERS. Jennifer grins at Needy through the cracking glass. Needy screams again, puts the pedal to the floor, and manages to rear up out of the ditch. Jennifer's body tumbles off the car as Needy goes roaring down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was, of course, Soft Shoulder. They're going to be playing a benefit concert in Devil's Kettle next month. Talk about giving back to the community! Generous guys, I tell ya...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy throws the car into park and races up the front walk. She unlocks the door, shaking and fumbling. She bursts into the darkened house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy! Mommy? Please be home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No reply. Needy braces herself against the kitchen counter and bawls. She falls to her knees and curls up on the floor, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes drift shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always been able to feel what she feels. Just not like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Needy and Little Jennifer are playing Barbies in a sandbox. Needy holds a brand new, immaculate Barbie doll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be Perfect Prom Barbie and you be her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tosses Needy a naked brunette doll with its hair chopped off and an arm missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I have to be Ugly Ashley?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can be Ugly Ashley or Ken. Choose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts her hand down in the sand emphatically and suddenly HOWLS in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Jennifer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer lifts her hand. There's a TACK stuck in her palm and it's bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OWWWWWW! (trying to swear like a grown-up) Damn! Ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy grabs Jennifer's hand, pulls out the tack and wipes away the blood. It's still bleeding. Panicking, she leans forward and instinctively puts her mouth to the wound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer watches quietly. Needy pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better. We should get a Band-Aid though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're sisters now, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell my mom about this. She'll make me get a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never tell on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy WAKES UP in a cold sweat, gasping. She's still on the kitchen floor. She peels herself up off the floor, disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy trudges into her dark bedroom. She strips off her clothes and stumbles into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Monistat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy flicks on her bedside lamp, petrified. Jennifer is curled up in bed beside her, reclining casually. She's freshly showered and wearing one of Needy's dorky T- shirts. Needy screams at the top of her lungs and leaps out of bed, pulling the covers with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, enough screaming already. You're such a cliche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we always share your bed when we have slumber parties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She winks conspiratorially at Needy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. I have never heard you drop the F-bomb before. What's buggin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw you! I saw you! The car...the...I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buh-buh-buh. Slow down, tardy slip. You sound like a sped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm calling the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, narc me out. I've got the cops in my back pocket. I'm fucking a cadet, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to explain some things to you. You've already seen too much and besides-- best friends don't keep secrets. Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy nods, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the night of the fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it rings a bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I got pretty messed up. I almost died. You know those guys in Soft Shoulder? Totally evil. They're basically agents of Satan with awesome haircuts. I figured that out as soon as I got into their molester van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is crouched in the back of the van. None of the band members are speaking. Nikolai Wolf drives down a gravel road, away from the fire site and deep into the woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys? Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut your mouth, object.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer looks around the van, wide-eyed. There's glow-in the-dark Satanic imagery painted all over the walls: goats heads, pentagrams, and strange coded writing. She sees a few books sliding around on the floor: "Spells and Incantations," "Summoning the Beast," and a copy of the Black Mass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer springs to her feet and tries to escape out the side door. MICK, the drummer, grabs her ankles, taking her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you guys rapists?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer struggles again, but Mick holds her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to band members) Hey guys? Do we even know if she's a virgin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GLINT OF HOPE in Jennifer's eyes. Maybe if she lies she can save herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...yes! Of course I'm a virgin! I've never done sex ever. I don't even know how. So maybe you should find some other girl who does. Know how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you, Dirk. You owe me a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van rumbles down an uneven forest path, deep into the woods. They arrive at the real Devil's Kettle-- roaring, ominous waterfalls. There's a crude stone altar illuminated by moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy is still cowering on her bedroom floor, captivated by the tale in progress. Jennifer is reclining in the bed with a relaxed, supernatural glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did they do to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let me finish. So they drove all the way out to the falls. I tried to figure out an escape, but it was so dark out there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door of the van slides open. Nikolai pulls Jennifer out of the van and hustles her into the clearing. He looks up into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a waxing moon. Perfection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the man, Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four band members surround Jennifer, looking statuesque in their sexy rock n' roll ensembles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without warning, Nikolai hauls off and KICKS Jennifer. She yelps and falls onto her back on the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirk looks apprehensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if we should go through with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to be rich and famous like the guy from Maroon 5? Or do you want to be a huge suicidal loser?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maroon 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then grow a pair and fetch me the ritual! God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirk obediently heads over to the van. He pushes the intimidating-looking magical books aside and retrieves a single folded piece of computer paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? I found it on Google.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unfolds the piece of paper and clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys have dragged Jennifer onto the makeshift altar and are holding her down. She struggles and screams, but Dirk slaps her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We come here tonight to sacrifice the body of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to remember Jennifer's name and fails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...this chick from Devil's Kettle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirk and Mick exchange nervous glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please let me go. I'll do anything. Anything you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai examines her with an appraising eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only hump nines and tens. You're a seven at best, even with the chicken cutlets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into Jennifer's bra and casually pulls out a GEL BREAST ENHANCER, tossing it aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer rears up and SPITS in his artfully rumpled hair. Nikolai smooths his `do, enraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna carve you like a pumpkin, bitch. Don't you know that me and my boys are in league with the Beast himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wiggles his menacingly pointy fingers in her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've spent months making offerings to the "man downstairs," and whaddya know? Satan delivered! We went from college radio to being courted by the majors in two months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's not enough, Jenny. We want designer drugs. We want groupies that have their own groupies. We want speedballs and stadium tours and Skittles sorted by color. In short, we want more. And to get more, we have to butcher you. And bleed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you could just hire a publicist. Make some T-shirts or something. Hey, I could be on your street team!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start chanting, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group begins chanting jibberish in unison. Jennifer struggles, watching as their eyes go hollow and black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With deepest malice, we deliver this virgin unto thee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unsheathes a huge, gleaming knife and raises it Psycho style, admiring his reflection in the blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, that is a hot murder weapon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bowie knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bowie. Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snickering, Nikolai begins to sing "Starman" by David Bowie. The group joins in merrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "There's a starman waiting in the sky..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "He'd really like to meet us, but he thinks he'd blow our minds..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the group sings, Nikolai brings the knife down with a grin. We hear Jennifer SCREAMING, sounds of violence and clothes ripping as Nikolai relentlessly beats her and stabs her, his face contorting demonically. The band continues to sing, their voices carrying over the trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai walks over to where the "devil side" of the falls rushes into a black hole. He drops the murder weapon into the churning water, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy's expression is both incredulous and horrified. Jennifer is totally matter-of-fact. She picks at her nails with a wooden cuticle stick from Needy's night stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being tortured would make most girls black out or something. But I'm so hard core, I was with them the whole time. I could feel them gutting me Under my ribs, up into my belly, then right through my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They...killed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head, annoyed with Needy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, yeah. They went Benihana on my ass. It should have killed me. But for some reason, it didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. Anyway, I don't really remember what happened after that. I just-- woke up a few hours later and found my way back, somehow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jennifer staggering down the street, battered, mutilated and bloody. She spits a few TEETH onto the curb, clutching her chest. We see her wander toward Needy's house...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't bring myself to hurt you. I mean, I'm a really good friend. But I felt so hungry. I had to do something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is wandering down a rural road in a daze. She hears a faint COUGH. Jennifer stops and sees a hunched FIGURE walking down the opposite side of the street. It's AHMET FROM INDIA, the foreign student. He's covered in soot and looks traumatized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer takes a step. Ahmet takes a step. Jennifer stops. Ahmet stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their eyes meet. Jennifer crosses the street. Ahmet stares at her, frightened. Jennifer addresses him in a quiet, gravelly voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmet. You made it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmet coughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmet NODS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does your host family know you're alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmet shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does anyone know you're alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmet shakes his head again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me. We'll sort this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Ahmet's hand. As her BLOODY NAILS dig into his wrist, his eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever since then, I just somehow knew what I needed to do to be strong. And when I'm full--like I am right now--I'm like, immortal! I can do stuff like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer jams the CUTICLE STICK into her own forearm and drags it through her flesh. Needy screams and covers her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No biggie. Watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out the stick. The wound seals over instantly. Needy gasps and touches Jennifer's unmarked arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's some X-Men shit, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, "when you're full"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know. Full. Like full of tasty morsels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy shakes her head, not comprehending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. You'd probably tell on me anyway. Not that anyone would believe you. You always think the world is coming to an end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my mom's Kia? Why did you attack me out there? Why were you covered in blood? You didn't even look human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should talk to someone about these disturbing thoughts you're having. We're all concerned. Especially Chip. I think he's having second thoughts about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My, aren't we a C-U-Next-Tuesday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GET OUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Let me stay the night. We can play "boyfriend/girlfriend" like we used to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles seductively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy crawls further away from her, shivering. Jennifer rolls her eyes and gets out of bed. She walks over to the second-story window and cranks it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said to leave. So I'm outtie- 5000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She climbs onto the windowsill. Needy watches, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you at school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She LEAPS gracefully out the window. Needy watches in stunned silence for a few moments. Then she creeps over to the window and looks out. Nothing there but the wind. Jennifer's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a small Catholic cemetery. A small, neat gravel path runs through the stately old monuments into a small valley where a funeral is taking place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faint moaning and sobbing can be heard. Then, a procession of 6 or 7 GOTH/EMO KIDS appears on the crest of the hill. They move forward into the cemetery, flamboyantly dressed in black capes, chains, cloaks, neon hairpieces, fishnets, mesh, 18-hole combat boots, etc. These are Colin Gray's friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One girl scatters blood-red rose petals dramatically on the path as she stumbles along, weeping. At the bottom of the hill, Colin Gray's very conservative looking family stands next to the fresh grave, surrounded by sympathetic mourners. NEEDY stands near the back, looking shell-shocked. There are also a few press photographers snapping photos, and of course, a Catholic priest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gather here today to celebrate the life of Colin Gray, who was plucked from the prime of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest and family are momentarily distracted by the motley crew of Goths descending on the funeral. The priest clears his throat disapprovingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this disturbance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are Colin's friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GOTH BOY runs up to the grave and drops to his belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin! Take me with you! I belong down there! In the DAAAARKNESS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Kevin. Those are just his fleshly remains. He's among the dark angels of the realm now. Fly, Colin. Fly into the firmament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lights a bundle of SAGE and waves it in the air. Colin's father gags, appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it cool if we camp here for a few days? We want to commune with his corpse. He was our spooky homeboy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Children, this is a private service for family only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Colin's mother) Oh, right. I need to ask you something, Mrs. Gray. It's really important for me to have closure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young lady, have some respect for this family...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving him off) No. It's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true that Colin had a date with Jennifer Check the night he was killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says "Jennifer Check" as if it were the most disgusting name imaginable. Needy covers her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because Jennifer Check is a social disease. She's not like us. She thinks she's so special just because she's popular and and is what "society" considers "attractive." But she's not sincere. She's about as emo as a breast implant! And she listens to Jessica Simpson and shops at Hollister. And I just know Colin would never go out with someone like that, and I just need confirmation. From you. So did he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a date with Jennifer Check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin's parents stare at the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God. Oh God. I knew it! That BITCH! I will erase her! I'll put a freaky Druid spell on her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll spell her preppy ass right into the ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parents flinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Chloe? Maybe you should be mad at the person who murdered Colin. All Jennifer Check did was invite him over to watch Aquamarine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's WORSE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws herself to the ground, crying and pounding the dirt like a toddler. Colin Gray's mother buries her head in her hands and begins weeping. Mr. Gray attempts to comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colin wouldn't have liked this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing it) Oh, you think so, Powder? Yeah, you're right! I'm pretty sure my son wouldn't have liked being eaten by a fucking CANNIBAL and buried before his eighteenth birthday! Wow, you must have known him so well!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The goth boy looks terrified. But Mrs. Gray's not done ranting yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time they found Colin in that godforsaken house, he looked like lasagna with teeth. I'd know-- I had to identify the remains. My boy's not in the realm of the undead. He's not flying around in the firmament with magical wings of flame. He's in an overpriced rosewood box that's headed six feet downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kicks the coffin to illustrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you can take your pain and shove it up your asses, kids. I got the monopoly on pain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids stare at her in awe. Needy watches as Mrs. Gray collapses into Mr. Gray's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two girls are hanging an homemade banner on the fence surrounding the football field. It says "TURNABOUT DANCE

dialogues.speaker: OCTOBER 5
dialogues.text: Needy walks briskly toward school, huddled in her parka. She looks totally fucked up, like she hasn't slept in days. There are hollows beneath her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did a big memorial assembly for Colin at school, and we had to watch another presentation about curfews and the buddy system and how to deal with grief. But nobody seemed to care anymore. Sorrow was last week's emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jennifer a few yards away, talking and laughing with some other flag team members.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer and I hadn't spoken since our encounter in my room. Actually, I hadn't really spoken to anyone. I was busy with research. Paranormal research.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy gazes off into the distance with bloodshot eyes. As she stares at Jennifer, she see has a series of brief, gruesome HALLUCINATIONS: Jennifer as a grinning death mask. Jennifer as a corpse, the lower half of her face rotted away. Jennifer as a harlequin monster. Needy hears the rush of her own blood, the barely audible buzzing of flies... Chip jogs up next to her, jolting her out of her reverie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Did you buy Turnabout tickets yet? I don't get paid until next week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta show you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here. Behind the school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this about Jennifer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but I promise you this is the last thing I need to show y--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy, I care about you. A lot. As a person, not just a girl I made love to for four minutes the other night. And I'm scared of what's happening to you. You're acting really fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please just let me show you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her gaze is so intense and crazed that Chip has no option but to submit. He nods reluctantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy and Chip walk to an alley behind the school. Melting snow drips off the eaves. Needy pulls out a large black binder and opens it. It's full of copies from the library and Internet printouts. The spine reads "JENNIFER RESEARCH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thrusts a piece of paper into CHIP's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demon...demonic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demonic transference. It's something that happens when you try to sacrifice a virgin to Satan without using an actual virgin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's what happened to Jennifer. Those guys from that band were trying to sacrifice her in the woods. But what they didn't realize is that she hasn't been a virgin since junior high! Jennifer's a total cum-dumpster! It all makes sense now! Read this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs the piece of paper from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "If the human sacrifice is impure, the result may still be attained, but a demon will forever reside the soul of the victim. She must forever feed on flesh to sustain the demon." See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP looks more dubious than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's eating boys! They make her strong. Really strong. And when she's hungry, she gets weak and cranky and her hair is all full of split ends. And look at this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up one of the printouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says that before the demon feeds, it vomits a gruesome substance on its prey. Like I saw!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You--you really think Jennifer killed Jonas and Colin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And possibly Ahmet from India.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy is silent for a moment. She realizes CHIP will never believe her and that she'll lose him forever if she continues babbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? You think she ate those guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No! Of course not!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...Listen, I'll make an appointment with Mr. Feely. I'm real sorry about this sudden onset of teenage paranoia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My hormones and emotions are aswirl, and my moods are erratic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP isn't totally convinced, but his face softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Needy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has been a crummy school year, Chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy turns and pitches the black binder into a Dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm done with all that devil stuff. Do you know what you're wearing to Turnabout?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking a suit with black shoes and a boutonniere, right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He taps his chest. Needy laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so in love with him. I didn't want to mess it up with my infectious crazy. Only I wasn't actually crazy. Everyone else was crazy. But when you're the only sane one, you might as well be crazy. It's subjective, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What color dress are you gonna wear? I need to order your wrist corsage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about magenta? You're definitely a winter. My mom says winters should wear regal jewel tones like magenta. Or possibly teal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, your mom's an Avon lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they call them "sales reps" now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Well, I'll try to find something magenta.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll look dope.

dialogues.speaker: EVENING
dialogues.text: A group of student council kids are putting the finishing touches on the dance decorations. The theme is "Through the Trees" and there are papier mache trees everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy stands in front of a full-length mirror, wearing a big `80s-style magenta prom dress. It sags on her flat chest and looks ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greedo the ferret circles her ankles. Toni, Needy's mom, appears behind her with a curling iron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look pork stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you've got that tiny waist, like a fashion model. I always thought you looked like Cindy Crawford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gently takes off Needy's glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Cindy Crawford?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the great beauties of our time. She's even got a mole like you, except hers is on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a section of Needy's hair and wraps it around the curling iron. Smoke rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow! You're too close to my neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if Chip gives you a hickey, you can just tell everyone I burned you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gross, Mom. Chip isn't that ostentatious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's a word you don't hear every day. Hold still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing to my hair?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooker helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, jeez Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can't have big what-nots, you might as well have big hair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy stares at herself in the mirror. Despite Toni's best efforts, Needy looks like the walking dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip is standing in underwear and black dress socks, taking his suit out of the closet. Suddenly, there's a loud KNOCK on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in underpants, Mom!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the voice of CHIP'S MOM through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to give you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip puts on a robe and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip's mom is holding a SMALL PINK AEROSOL CAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies' pepper spray?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking about it for a while, and I think you need to be carrying this. There's obviously a sicko out there who likes boys. Boys your age. And I don't want you going out there unarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can take care of myself. I've been using the Bowflex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, we can see the BOWFLEX with clothes hanging off it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear what Colin Gray looked like when they found him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lasagna with teeth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard. So unless you want to wind up looking like another exotic Eye-talian dish, take Mommy's rape spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip reluctantly accepts the spray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you picking Needy up at her house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeting her at the dance. I'm gonna walk. It's so warm outside. It's like 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want pictures with your sister before you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy is fully dressed and garishly made up. Toni holds a digital camera at arm's length and takes a shot of the two of them together. The mother/daughter photo looks ghastly. Toni's eyes are closed and Needy pouts miserably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip's mother snaps a series of stiffly posed photos of Chip and his little sister, Camille. We can see the PEPPER SPRAY tucked into the interior of Chip's jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more. Back to back. Big smiles. Camille, we don't touch ourselves down there. That's our lady garden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gym is decorated to look like an enchanted forest. A large banner reads "Through the Trees- Turnabout Dance" There are streamers and balloons everywhere in sickly shades of green and purple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DJ plays badly-mixed pop music. Couples drift into the gym. The GOTH KIDS who were at Colin Gray's grave travel in a pack, sulking. The goth girl who loved Colin wanders through the decorations and pops every balloon she passes with a pin. As she pops them, she narrates dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (popping balloon) This is my heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (popping balloon) My soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (popping balloon) Everything I once believed in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another GOTH GIRL, looking exasperated, grabs a balloon, shoves it under her babydoll dress and pops it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your abortion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rapidly shoves another one under her dress and pops it again, smirking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your other abortion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate your guts, Madison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls glare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy walks in, looking small and apprehensive in her bad `80s dress. She looks around for Chip, but he's not there yet. A few mean kids point at her dress and snicker. Needy ladles some juice into a paper cup and leans against the wall, waiting anxiously for her Prince Charming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip is cutting through the park on his way to the dance. He whistles to himself. Across the park, he sees a STRAY DOG trotting toward him. The dog pants aggressively. CHIP tries to smile, but looks uncomfortable. A few SQUIRRELS emerge from the trees, gazing curiously at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couples are beginning to grind against each other on the dance floor. Needy watches them longingly. She checks her Mickey Mouse watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip picks up the pace, jogging down the path. In the distance behind him we can barely make out Jennifer's form. She looks more spectral then we've ever seen her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip speeds up instinctively. Suddenly, Jennifer's about ten paces closer. Then she's closer again, as if she can fold space and time. She's ethereal, flickering. CHIP turns to look over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music fades out and there's a squeal of feedback from the sound system. Mr. Wroblewski walks onto the stage in a bad suit. He awkwardly picks up the mic with his one good hand and pats it with his robotic one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I have everyone's attention please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students turn to look at him, annoyed by the distraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Turnabout Dance. I hope you've all had an opportunity to consume the Pecan Sandies and Cran-Grape that were so generously donated by the Parents Club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murmuring and applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the real treat is yet to come. It's happening right about now, this treat of which I speak. We have some very special guests tonight. They were kind enough to take a break from their sold-out national tour and play our dance for free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy gags on her juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip continues to hurry briskly along through the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP makes an incoherent noise and jumps as Jennifer appears, improbably, right in front of him. She's wearing a gorgeous white formal gown and looks perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you hear me calling your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't calling my name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you were maybe spacing out. You were like this: Derrrrr.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She mimics a blank, drooling expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, exactly like that. Listen, I need to talk to you about you-know- who. Our little Needy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you worried? `Cause I'm super- stressed about her. God knows how I even sleep at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hasn't been the same for weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know what's wrong with her. In fact, I know I know what's wrong with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel bad telling you this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you know Needy's been a total Lithium candidate since the night Colin Gray died. But that's not just because he was brutally murdered and stuff. It's because....I don't wanna say this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy and Colin were intimate. By that I mean he was poking her donut on a semi-regular basis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP looks astonished and hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this must be hard for you to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy's not like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what she wants you to believe. But trust me, her and Colin were doing stuff you haven't even heard of. Total varsity moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were with Colin the night he was killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, apparently he had a thing for me-- no surprise there. And I figured Needy was busy jumping your jock that night, so I agreed to a little pity date. Colin brought me to that empty house so we could have some privacy. But he wanted to go too far, so I left after a few minutes. Next thing I knew, they'd found...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sniffles, wiping her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what was left of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Eye-talian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry you had to hear this from me. I'm just so worried about Needy. She's losing her shit. Colin was her everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP looks miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be surprised if she winds up in the nuthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you've been talking to her more than I have. How bad is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bad, man. It's bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can only imagine the paranoid theories she's come up with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't believe she would do this to you. I care so much about you, Chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP glances up at her. She's earnest, beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than I've ever had the guts to admit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Wroblewski pauses dramatically for effect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys and girls, please welcome...Soft Shoulder!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The heavy stage curtains part to reveal SOFT SHOULDER in all their glory. Success has treated them well-- they're glowing and wearing designer rock n' roll couture. They look like the young Rolling Stones. Needy drops her cup. Juice splatters onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening, babies. Are you ready for some bad vibrations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students rush the stage, shrieking. Nikolai raises his fist and the band launches into a heavy, uptempo version of "Through the Trees." Needy looks as though she's had a revelation. A look of pure horror crosses her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes toward the gym exit, tripping in her high heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP is hypnotized in the glow of the streetlights. Jennifer leans forward and kisses him on the neck

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy didn't deserve a boy like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy is running toward the park in her gown. She takes off her shoes and tosses them aside, her arms and legs pumping furiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One thing people don't know about me is that I'm fast. I just never went out for track because I look bad in shorts. Also, Jennifer told me track was for lezzies. But I am. Fast, I mean. Even in that fucking afterbirth of a dress, I could really tear up the asphalt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picks up the pace, cheeks puffing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to. I was running for his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is kissing Chip. She pulls him down onto the damp, muddy grass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, you're so salty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it like you mean it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so salty. I need water. It burns. The salty burns my mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say I'm better than Needy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We really shouldn't be doing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls away from him, feigning a guilty conscience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're better than Needy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer smiles, satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She resumes kissing him enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This feels weird. Can we go somewhere else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have just the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up and starts to lead Chip toward an abandoned, fenced-off COMMUNITY POOL. It's drained and spooky and looks dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy Pool? I don't think we can go in there. I knew some skater guys who went in there. They got in big trouble and now they have to pick up garbage for 100 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer giggles and pulls him along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in big trouble anyway. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to climb the chain link fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy jogs toward CHIP's house. Exhausted and sweaty, she presses the doorbell. She falls to her knees on the front stoop, panting and wheezing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, hi there Camille! Is Chipper home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille has no reply. She eyes Needy suspiciously and licks a Popsicle. CHIP's mother appears and shoves Camille aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy? Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Chip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left for the dance at least twenty minutes ago. He certainly should have been there by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walked? Mrs. Dove, you mean to only tell me that in these dangerous, godless times-- you let your only son walk alone at night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's only five blocks. My God, your hair is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way did he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He usually cuts across the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to scold Camille.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camille, let's sit like a lady! No one wants to see your kiki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back to address Needy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you try...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Needy's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anita?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy Pool is even eerier from the inside. The fenced-in deck area is littered with garbage, abandoned pool furniture and graffiti. Someone has spray painted the word "HOPELESS" on a wall. CHIP shivers and looks around nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer nonchalantly unzips her dress and shimmies out of it, revealing her bra and panties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you cold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never, Trevor. I'm hot like magma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She prances over to the abandoned pool and begins to climb down the ladder on the side. The pool is full of filthy, freezing water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swimming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in, Chip. Show me your breast stroke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water looks disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not so bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? It's totally bubonic in there. I think I see a dead possum with a Doritos bag in its pouch. And that looks like a used syringe over there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slaps away a FLY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I was just trying to make you laugh. I think now, more than ever, we need laughter. We've both lost a close friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHIP nods sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel so empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please come here and kiss me again. Make all this madness go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip tiptoes forward tentatively and sinks to his knees. He leans in and kisses Jennifer, who's still clinging to the ladder. The sound of buzzing flies grows louder. Suddenly, Jennifer opens her eyes. She hooks her arm around Chip's neck and lunges backward. They tumble off the ladder, into the pool. Chip SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy runs into the park and scans the dark horizon. Her bare feet are bloody from running and her face is shiny with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A terrified SCREAM in the distance. Needy whips around, hikes up her skirt and starts running toward Murphy Pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches the fence and starts climbing it. She slips and cuts her hand on a broken link. CHIP screams again on the other side of the fence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flings herself over the top of the fence, her body slamming against the concrete pool deck. Her ARM snaps. It's a compound fracture, the bone thrusting through the flesh of her arm as she screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy staggers toward the pool, which is surrounded by an extraterrestrial glow. Chip's moaning is almost unbearable. Needy stares into the abyss and claps her hands over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer is waist deep in the DIRTY WATER, flinging Chip against the wall like a rag doll. He's still conscious, but his skin on his chest has been RIPPED OFF to expose his ribs. Jennifer is CHEWING happily. Chip looks at Needy, his face a mask of agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy crap!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer begins gnawing on Chip's neck, so engaged in the task that she doesn't notice Needy. Needy climbs up on the diving board and crosses herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saint Jude, patron saint of hopeless causes: Please give me the power to crush this bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer looks up with demonic, bloodshot eyes just as Needy leaps off the diving board. Needy lands on Jennifer's shoulders, taking her out. She wraps her legs around Jennifer's neck and drags her under the water. Jennifer emerges. Needy grabs her by the hair and girly- slaps her furiously across the face. Then she spots the PEPPER SPRAY lying by the side of the pool. She grabs it and sprays it in Jennifer's eyes. Jennifer shrieks and vomits NASTY, SPINY GORE all over Needy and Chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this J.V. shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer ROCKETS straight up into the air like a goddess, hovering ten feet above the pool. Her eyes burn. Her skin is corpselike. She's drenched from head to toe in the prickly ooze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She can fly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's just hovering, CHIP. It's not that impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer speaks in a metallic, demonic-sounding voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, do you have to undermine everything I do? You're such a player-hater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy glares at Jennifer, surprisingly fearless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice insult, Lizzie McGuire. Got any more harsh digs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what? You were never a good friend. Ever. Even when we were little. You used to steal my toys and pour lemonade on my bed and make me be Ugly Ashley when we played Barbies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now I'm eating your boyfriend! See? At least I'm consistent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you need him? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you need the one guy who's ever liked me? You can have anyone, Jennifer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cutest guy in school. The mailman. A teacher. You could probably even have a huge star like Chad Michael Murray. So why Chip? Why him? Is it just to piss me off? Or is it because you're insecure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer floats in midair toward the pool deck and drifts down, landing on her feet. Needy crawls out of the pool and faces her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not insecure. God, what a joke! How could I be insecure? I was the Snowflake Queen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, two years ago. When you were socially relevant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I AM STILL SOCIALLY RELEVANT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were skinny then, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of ABJECT HORROR on Jennifer's face. She reels back against the chain link fence, her eyes blazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna eat your soul and shit it out, Lesnicki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice is now an unearthly growl. In the background, Chip is slowly, painfully pulling a POOL SKIMMER with an eight-foot handle off the pool deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you only murdered boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go both ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She HURTLES herself toward Needy, roaring, her eyes white hot, her jaws agape. She's monstrous. Chip suddenly stumbles in front of Needy and holds the HANDLE of the POOL SKIMMER in front of them like a spear. As Jennifer flies forward at demonic speed, she IMPALES HER ENTIRE TORSO on the handle. Needy screams. There's a beat of deafening silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip collapses on the pool deck. Jennifer rises uncertainly to her feet, "shishkebabbed" on the giant skimmer. With effort, she pulls the handle out of her body in several stages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow-Ow-Ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy watches, and realizes Jennifer is injured. Blood drips onto the pool deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hurt you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood trickles out of Jennifer's wound. She tries to plug the hole with her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a tampon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy shakes her head mutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought I'd ask. You seemed like you might be pluggin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to climb the fence, wincing in pain, then glances over her shoulder at Needy and Chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this noise. I'm out. You losers are more trouble then you're worth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
