dialogues.text: She continues climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why give up now? He's almost dead! Get your bulimic ass back here and kill us both!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah. I mean, you say I've been a bad friend all these years. I might as well throw you a bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smirks and jumps over the fence, stumbling off into the distance. Needy watches her, her eyes narrowing with hate. Once Jennifer has disappeared, Needy turns her attention to Chip, who is barely alive. She stares in horror at his torn arm and exposed ribs, then falls to her knees over his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Chip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy. You saved me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna call for help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches into Chip's pocket and pulls out his beat-up cell phone. She wipes off the prickly ooze with her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, I'm out of minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think 911 is always a free call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy dials to no avail. The phone is hopelessly clogged with ooze. She knocks it against the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not working. It's full of Jennifer-goo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip begins gagging and coughing. He rolls onto his back, his eyelids fluttering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm going somewhere...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You're not going anywhere!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm toast, Needy. I'm definitely gonna die. I think I already died before you were here, but I woke up when I heard your voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah me too. And you look hot in that dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're clearly delirious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. When you're dying, you can see everything a lot clearer. You can see what's true and what's not. The things that are true have this glowing halo of light around them, like a picture of the Baby Jesus, or Barbara Walters when they use the special lens. And I know for sure that you're totally hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy begins to sob hoarsely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd better get out of here. The police are going to come and I don't want them to, you know, make a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm never leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip's eyes close. His face relaxes. He's gone. Needy wails at the top of her lungs. She rests her head against his mutilated chest, oblivious to the blood and bone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dance is in full swing and students are slow-dancing. Girls rest their heads against boys' chests, only under far less macabre circumstances than Needy and CHIP's deathbed tableau. Soft Shoulder are still playing onstage, their guitars chiming melodically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bass player, Dirk, turns toward Nikolai Wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sucks old-man balls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. It's good PR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He accidentally speaks into the mic, attracting unwanted stares from the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to audience) I said, it's so good to be here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The students cheer approvingly, their faces bright and hopeful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai bares his teeth in a frighteningly fake smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Illuminated by lamp light, Needy limps toward the gym entrance. She's completely covered in demon-goo. Her face is bloody, her hair is full of blood and guts, and her BROKEN ARM looks gruesome. In the background, yet another oblivious COUPLE are making out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy stops to stare at them, her gaze calm but obviously insane. They break apart and stare back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at, Clumpy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just watching your old man try to suck the ugly off your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy bends over, casually holds one nostril closed, and does a "farmer blow." A bloody clot flies out of her nose. The guy takes a good look at Needy and blinks, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you supposed to be Goth or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know the original Goths were a Germanic tribe that settled in Rome? They didn't wear black. They wore regular linen tunics. I don't know why nobody else knows that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The couple have already resumed making out. Needy rolls her eyes, turns away, and continues limping into the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy enters the gym and slams the door shut behind her. People ignore her as she slowly walks toward the stage. They're too busy slow dancing and laughing in their respective cliques. She looks up at the stage, where Soft Shoulder are playing an insufferably long coda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai noodles through a guitar solo, then looks up and sees Needy looking directly at him, her eyes full of hate. Nikolai gulps nervously and elbows Dirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy points to her eyes with two fingers, then points at Nikolai, as if to say, Gotcha. She looks completely possessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Dirk) We gotta get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think this girl's flipping out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could she do to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirk takes one look at Needy's face and takes off his guitar. Nikolai motions for the rest of the band to leave the stage. The music stops abruptly. The kids in the gym murmur and complain, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy tries to follow them. She limps blindly toward the stage and climbs up. Everyone watches, gasping in horror. By now the band is disappearing out the side door of the gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the mic) You didn't play your hit yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they're gone. Needy looks out at her classmates. They stare back. She PASSES OUT COLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They found Chip the following morning. The police couldn't find an explanation for the "substance" in the pool, so they chose not to mention it to the press. In fact, they treated the whole incident like a bad dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the POLICE (including newly minted officer ROMAN DUDA) informing Chip's mother that his body has been found. She collapses onto the floor, curling up into the fetal position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trouble was, some of us would never wake up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy is lying in bed, shaking, her arm in a cast. Her mother tries to rouse her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never went back to school after that. Didn't talk much either. My mom bought some books so she could teach me at home like crazy Christians with 14 kids do. But I wasn't a very cooperative student.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy pulls the covers over her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toni shrugs, resigned, and tosses the book on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy is crouched outside Jennifer's window, hiding in the shrubbery. She looks almost feral, with wide eyes and a hungry expression. Through the window, we see Jennifer sitting at a vanity and combing her hair, oblivious to the intruder in her yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What nobody realized was that I was doing a different kind of homework. I was watching her every night. Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jennifer putting the comb down and examining her hair with a appraising eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for her to get weak and dull. Waiting for her to burn through the life-force she'd stolen from Chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy creeps away from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took weeks, but I finally made my move. Remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're seeing a FLASHBACK of the night Needy slaughtered Jennifer. Needy plunging through the window. Jennifer thrashing. The blood. The struggle. The levitation. The arrival of the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even in her last moments of life, she somehow managed to be cooler than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see, for a moment, Jennifer's sly, challenging smile as Needy raises the boxcutter to slash her. That signature look of mastery and control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She left an insanely hot corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jennifer's mother holding her again, screaming, though all we hear is SILENCE and STATIC. Sure enough, Jennifer's bleeding body seems to be artfully, sensually draped in her mother's arms. She almost seems to be SMIRKING at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're back in solitary confinement, where Needy has been narrating the whole sordid tale. She hasn't moved a muscle since beginning her story. Only a single shaft of moonlight illuminates the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An orderly shoves DINNER through a slot in the door. It's a pile of mystery meat. Needy wrinkes her nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even know who Needy Lesnicki is anymore. I'm a different person now. A person who uses curse words and kicks orderlies and and sees things that aren't there. A very bad, very damaged person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy reaches up and distractedly pulls back the neckline of her shirt...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sometimes, change can be good. For instance, most occult scholars don't know this, but if you're bitten by a demon--and you live-- you just might absorb some of the demon's abilities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the moonlight, we see Needy still has a infected- looking BITEMARK near her shoulder. She scratches it, wincing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just might get lucky for once in your miserable life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal that Needy, still cross-legged is HOVERING five feet off the floor. Effortlessly. With visible concentration, she slowly flies up toward a narrow WINDOW positioned up near the ceiling. To anyone with normal abilities, it would be impossible to access.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy reaches the window, gazes at it for a moment, then SMASHES it with surprising strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy strolls across the grounds in her bunny slippers. She heads confidently toward the SECURITY FENCE and passes through it after casually mangling the bars. Only a Needy-shaped hole remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy is striding purposefully down a dark country road. The hospital recedes in the background. A few RACCOONS gather by the side of the road, watching Needy as she walks past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PICKUP TRUCK whizzes by with its windows rolled down. "Through the Trees" blasts from the radio. Needy begins to sing, a lopsided grin on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Through the trees, I will find you. Heal the ruins left inside you..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devil's Kettle citizens are gathered around Murphy Pool, crying. It's a CANDLELIGHT MEMORIAL for Chip. Their faces are weary and sorrowful. Photos of Chip have been arranged around the edge of the fence. We see a picture of CHIP AND NEEDY on the end. Someone has brought a CD player, and the mourners sing along, their voices soaring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...And the stars will remind you, we'll meet again..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy holds her thumb aloft as she walks down the remote country highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...We'll meet again."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small creek emptying into a stream   runs parallel to t road. Needy seems something glinting   at the mouth of th creek and stoops to pick it up. It's   Nikolai's BOWIE KNIFE, the one he threw into Devil's   Kettle, never to b seen again. Needy picks it up and tucks it into her waistband. A STATION WAGON comes rattling up the road. Needy sticks her thumb out again. The wagon pulls over to the side of the road. The driver, a grizzled older man, rolls down the window. He eyes Needy lasciviously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you looking to go, young lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: East, toward Madison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: East, huh? Guess I'm headed that way. But I'm gonna need you to pay me in ass, gas or grass. Got that? No free rides in this wagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have any money or drugs, so you'll have to settle for ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough. Hop in my chariot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy gratefully hurries into the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why you headed East?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm following this rock band.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Must be a hell of a group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight's gonna be their last show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Needy smiles blithely and pops the clear Lifesaver into her mouth. The station wagon pulls off. As it sputters off into the distance, we see a road sign that reads, ironically, SOFT SHOULDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the song on the radio end, segueing into the DJ's bumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a song. Thought we'd play that one in honor of Soft Shoulder. They're playing in Madison tonight. Should be a night to remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DJ's voice fades out as the car vanishes into the horizon.
